res: Assume that $\lvert f(x) \rvert \le 1$ and $\lvert f''(x) \rvert \le 1$ for all $x$ on an interval of length at least 2. Show that $\lvert f'(x) \rvert \le 2$ on the interval.
Translating: Assume that $\lvert f(x) \rvert \le 1$ and $\lvert f''(x) \rvert \le 1$ for all $x$ on an interval of length at least 2. Show that $\lvert f'(x) \rvert \le 2$ on the interval.

res.typeView:
∀ {f : ℝ → ℝ} {a b : ℝ},
  2 ≤ b - a →
    (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc a b, |f x| ≤ 1) → (∀ x ∈ Set.Icc a b, |deriv^[2] f x| ≤ 1) → ∀ x ∈ Set.Icc a b, |deriv f x| ≤ 2
